com.willblaschko.android.alexa.sender

Class SendData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.willblaschko.android.alexa.sender.SendData
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SendText, SendVoice

    public abstract class SendData
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class that supplies a DataOutputStream which is used to send a POST request to the AVS server with a voice data intent, it handles the response with completePost() (called by extending classes)

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      protected java.io.DataOutputStream mOutputStream

      protected AvsResponse completePost()
      When finished adding voice data to the output, we close it using completePost() and it is sent off to the AVS server and the response is parsed and returned

    • Method Detail

      • preparePost

        protected void preparePost(java.lang.String url,
                           java.lang.String accessToken)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Set up all the headers that we need in our HttpURLConnection POST, this prepares the connection for the raw audio that we'll need to pass to the AVS server
        Parameters:
        url - the URL we're posting to (this only has one option currently, but passing that in in case it changes)
        accessToken - the access token of the user who has given consent to the app
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if we can't perform our operations on the mConnection (not initiated, etc)

      • completePost

        protected AvsResponse completePost()
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   AvsException
        When finished adding voice data to the output, we close it using completePost() and it is sent off to the AVS server and the response is parsed and returned
        Returns:
        AvsResponse with all the data returned from the server
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        AvsException

      • parseResponse

        public AvsResponse parseResponse(java.io.InputStream inpStr,
                                 byte[] boundary)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Assumes a single part in the multipart blob with the audio data
        Parameters:
        inpStr - the input stream as a result of our HttpURLConnection POST
        boundary - the boundary we're using to separate the multiparts
        Returns:
        the parsed AvsResponse
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
